definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: Material evidence must also be original.
There is no physical evidence or accurate description on record.
sentences.chinese: 沒有物證或者記錄下來的準確描述來證明這些理論。

sentences.english: Black insulating tapes are familiar evidence at criminal sites.
sentences.chinese: 黑色絕緣膠帶是犯罪現場的常見物證。

sentences.english: The police began sorting through a trove of physical evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警察開始整理有價值的物證。

sentences.english: He evidenced his accusation with some material evidence.
sentences.chinese: 他以一些物證作爲控告的證據。

sentences.english: "Material evidence" of the ancient images at Mexico's Bonampak site?
sentences.chinese: 在墨西哥遠古的波拿蒙派克遺址的“物證”照片？

sentences.english: Material evidence shall also be original.
There it is, all blood-stained, on the desk, as a testimony of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 血跡斑斑的，在那張桌子上，充作物證。

sentences.english: The aqueduct is the material evidence of mankind civilization development.
sentences.chinese: 高架渠是人類文明發展的主要物證。

sentences.english: Physical evidence shall also be original.
And if a weapon was found, then that lends real credence to self-defense as a motive.
sentences.chinese: 兇器既然已經發現，那麼對自衛一說提供了有利物證。

sentences.english: Gang village will report the results of the survey to Wu Zhongyi lang, the witness in.
sentences.chinese: 岡村將調查結果彙報給武忠一郎，此事人證物證具在。

sentences.english: The material evidence investigated and collected by the investigating personnel shall be the original material.
sentences.chinese: 調查人員調查收集的物證應當是原物。

sentences.english: No obvious physical evidence of such a collision has been found.
sentences.chinese: 但調查人員並沒有找到碰撞發生的明顯物證。

sentences.english: Preserve all the physical evidence. Don't change clothes or wash.
sentences.chinese: 保留所有的物證，請勿換衣或清洗。

sentences.english: Forensics uses this technology to help uncover crimes.
sentences.chinese: 法醫物證學通過技術揭開犯罪謎底。

definition: an accounts office (in former times)/an accountant/a cashier
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to turn a blind eye to
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
